== Canadian Team Initiatives ==

=== Tabletop Standups ===
Tabletop <nowiki>[[CanadianTeam-standups|standups]]</nowiki> are used at Ubuntu Hours and other gatherings to identify Ubuntu Canada members. Download a GIMP file and create one for your chapter!

=== Ubuntu Vancouver ===

* <nowiki>[[https://www.avaneya.com|Avaneya]]</nowiki> is a cerebral science fiction game set on Mars currently under active development. It combines the perfect blend of the metropolis city builder social simulation, real time strategy, and cooperative multiplayer. It explores mature themes in social justice, politics, ecology, economics, and more. It is geared towards at least those with a passion for hard science fiction and software libre, in particular users of the <nowiki>[[https://www.gnu.org/gnu/gnu-users-never-heard-of-gnu.html|GNU operating system]]</nowiki> operating system and its various incarnations, such as Ubuntu.

=== Native Language Translation ===
Canada has many, many languages spoken in addition to the English and French that were imported by settlers who became the government.  It would be very Ubuntu-y if we could get translations for a few of those, especially the large ones (in approximate order): Cree, Inuktitut, Ojibwe, Montagnais-Naskapi, Micmac, Dakota/Sioux, Blackfoot, Mohawk, South Slave, Salish languages, Wakashan, Dogrib, Carrier, and Chipewyan.  Add yourself if you start working on one, or are thinking about it.
* Ojibwe/Ojibway - UbuntuOjibweTranslators - <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/people/ubuntu-l10n-oj|Launchpad page]]</nowiki> - <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/mailman/listinfo/ubuntu-l10n-oji|mailing list]]</nowiki> - TonyYarusso - <nowiki>[[https://translations.launchpad.net/ubuntu/dapper/+lang/oj|Status]]</nowiki>
* Inuktitut - UbuntuInuktitut - No LP team yet - No ML yet - Needs volunteers - <nowiki>[[https://translations.launchpad.net/ubuntu/dapper/+lang/iu|Status]]</nowiki>
